#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Wear Duck Boots with Jeans
#Text=Duck boots
#Text=are a hardy , waterproof style of boot that go great with a variety of outfits .
#Text=These boots often fit the bill regardless of your daily routine , whether you ’re hiking , going to work , or opting for a casual looks .
#Text=If you ’re getting dressed for work , or a job that requires a lot of manual labor , consider rolling up the cuffs of your jeans or tucking them into your boots .
#Text=For those looking for more casual styles , try slipping on some fun socks , or wearing some ripped jeans for a more rugged look .
#Text=As you experiment , you ’ll find that there ’s countless possibilities of how you can wear your duck boots with a pair of jeans !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Dressing for Work
#Text=Try on jeans that fit without being too baggy .
#Text=Stay comfortable at work by choosing a pair of jeans that fit you well .
#Text=Choose a pair of straight jeans that do n’t feel too tight on your waist and that give your legs enough breathing room .
#Text=If your line of work involves a lot of dirt and dust , opt for jeans in a darker color .
#Text=Ideally , you should n’t need a belt to hold up your jeans .
#Text=Roll up the cuffs of your jeans to tuck inside your boots .
#Text=Take the bottom edges of your pant legs and roll them up about .
#Text=Feel free to roll them up more or less as needed — ideally , you want them to be snug against the top edge of your duck boots .
#Text=Whenever you go to work , make sure that you ’re wearing socks that cover your ankles so all your skin is protected .
#Text=This is a great fix if your jeans are a bit too long around the ankle .
#Text=Tuck your jeans around your duck boots as an alternative .
#Text=If your jeans are a perfect fit for your height , you might not want to roll up the cuffs that much .
#Text=In this case , take the edges of your jeans and tuck them into your duck boots .
#Text=Pinch and push in the denim around your ankle so that it fits snugly in the boot and looks even on both sides .
#Text=This might be easier to accomplish with thinner socks .
#Text=Creating a Casual Outfit
#Text=Pair your boots with a nice blazer to give off an equestrian vibe .
#Text=Wear your jeans with a nice top and blazer so you look like you ’re about to go for a ride .
#Text=Even if your duck boots are n’t as tall as traditional riding boots , feel free to tuck the edges of your jeans into the boots to give off a polished look .
#Text=If you do n’t want to worry about tucking in any material , opt for skinny jeans instead .
#Text=If you actually are going for a ride , make sure you choose jeans that fit your body comfortably and are n’t too tight .
#Text=Pair your jeans and boots with a neutral top .
#Text=Go for a casual vibe by including more neutral tones in your outfit .
#Text=Keep in mind that many duck boots consist of dark , earthy tones like tan and dark brown .
#Text=With this in mind , set other elements of your outfit to match the tones in your boots .
#Text=You can really tie your ensemble together with a tan or dark brown top .
#Text=Try wearing a neutral-toned jacket or coat with your outfit as well !
#Text=Roll up your jeans to make your socks visible .
#Text=Take the bottom edges of your jeans and roll them up to form about a cuff .
#Text=Beneath your jeans , wear some long , fuzzy socks that you want to show off .
#Text=If you ’re feeling more traditional , opt for socks with solid tones and traditional patterns , like stripes and argyle .
#Text=If you want to make your look funkier , try wearing fuzzy socks , or socks with cute and fun patterns !
#Text=Opt for ripped jeans to give off a rugged vibe .
#Text=Add a pair of jeans to your outfit that has some rips and tears around different spots , like the knees and thighs .
#Text=If your jeans are n’t already ripped , try fraying some areas of your jeans with any grit of sandpaper .
#Text=For less obvious distress marks , try going over certain spots on your jeans with the edge of a bobby pin .
#Text=If you want a more dramatic look , feel free to cut into your jeans with a pair of scissors .
#Text=Pull your jeans over the edge of your boots for a classy look .
#Text=Go for a no-nonsense style by tucking the edges of your boots into your jeans .
#Text=If you do n’t want your duck boots to be the focal point of your outfit , this is a great option to try .
#Text=Try pairing this look with a polo or dress shirt to finish off the outfit .
#Text=You can dress this style up or down .
#Text=If you ’d prefer to look more casual , vie for a flannel or plaid shirt instead .
